intro: Leucanthemum reboudianum, commonly known as the French daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features showy white ray florets surrounding a central yellow disk, giving it a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has basal rosettes of gray-green, hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
